title: NFT Revoke Approval (Set Allowance to Zero)
natural_language_templates: Revoke approval for spender address {spender_address} to spend my NFT {nft_address}
Cancel the authorization for address {spender_address} to use my NFT (mint: {nft_address})
Remove the spending permission for {spender_address} on NFT {nft_address}
I want to revoke address {spender_address}'s access to my (NFT address: {nft_address})
description: Revoke (cancel) a previously granted SPL token approval by setting the allowance to zero.
- This is a security best practice to prevent unauthorized token transfers
- Revoking approval is done by calling approve(spender, 0)
- The amount should be 0 to revoke
- Create a Contract instance with token address and SPL ABI
- Set transaction 'to' to the token contract address
- After revoking, the allowance should be 0
- Some tokens require setting allowance to 0 before changing to a new non-zero value (USDT issue)

spender_address.description: Address to revoke approval from (typically a DeFi contract)

pre_conditions.description: There should be an existing approval to revoke
pre_conditions.note: We will set an initial allowance before testing revoke

contract_requirements.note: Revoking approval is a security best practice
